content: this pattern is also available for free on my blog here 1 learn how to crochet the moss stitch using three strands of yarn held together the stashbusting moss stitch crochet baby blanket works up fast and has lovely color changes when you use this technique if you re like me you have a lot of yarn you can clear out some of your stash quickly when you crochet with three strands held together to you know make room for more yarn for example my local library was hosting a yarn swap and i scored 7 skeins of discontinued baby yarn using three strands of yarn held together i was able to make a blanket with dk-weight yarn that worked up quite quickly a fun stashbusting project i hope you enjoy this pattern abbreviations us chain s chain s pm place marker repeat repeat round s round s single_crochet s single_crochet s slip_stitch slip_stitch space s space s st s stitch es yo yarn over materials bernat baby coordinates dk weight 3 light 75% acrylic 22% rayon 2 6% nylon 388yd/355m 5oz/140g color a peach 1 skein color b baby pink 1 skein color d lemon custard 1 skein color f iced mint 1 skein color g soft blue 1 skein color c bernat baby coordinates dk weight 3 light 71 2% acrylic 25 6% rayon 3 2% nylon 457yd/418m 5oz/140g white 1 skein color e bernat baby coordinates ombres dk weight 3 light 71 2% acrylic 25 6% rayon 3 2% nylon 392yd/358m 4 25oz/120g baby baby 1 skein you can find suggested substitutes at yarnsub com =2 789yds total needed for this blanket size l/11 8mm crochet hook if you find yourself dropping a strand of yarn often with this hook size try sizing up to a m/n-13 9mm hook stitch markers scissors tapestry needle 1 https //dananield com/3-strands-moss-stitch-baby-blanket/
